metadata.titel_preek: Easter Day and the Season of Easter

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher provides a narrative and exegetical journey through the darkness of the tomb, the doubt of Thomas, and the silence of Job. It focuses on the 'night' of human hope and the 'Who' of God's revelation.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Strong literary sensitivity to Johannine motifs (light/dark) and the structure of Job.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the reality of the resurrection and the nature of God's response to suffering, with moments of direct address and promise.
voorbeelden: We proclaim to you today not our own voice but the living Word of God.
I believe we can hold on to the promise.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from doubt/grief to a confession of 'My Lord and my God.'
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicitly mentioned at the end: 'Through the Word of God the Holy Spirit creates such faith.'

voorbeelden: The symbolism of night and darkness pervades the Gospel of John.
Jesus has entered the realm of Death.
The book of Job gives no answer at all to the problem of suffering.
It is a very comforting thing to me.
God... has power to grant his divine life to all who come to him.
I believe we can hold on to the promise that God has entered our pain.
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are often framed as 'about' God rather than God speaking directly through the preacher.

voorbeelden: We proclaim to you today... the living Word of God.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher claims the authority of a 'mandataris' but often retreats into description.

indicatoren: Extensive retelling of the biblical narrative in the 3rd person.
Theological explanations of why Job is satisfied.
Analyzing the 'symbolism' of the text rather than letting the text act.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of Mary, Thomas, and Job's faith rather than a participant in their own encounter.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the promise (Toezegging) in the 2nd person
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Faith is presented as a logical response to a 'Who' rather than a gift bestowed in the moment.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Mediated through the 3rd person or the preacher's own belief.
voorbeelden: God... has power to grant his divine life to all who come to him.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher's personal reflections and 'we' inclusive of the congregation.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address regarding suffering ('You will come to know')
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used more for diagnosis of pain than for the delivery of grace.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Mary, Thomas, Job, and God's actions in history.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: High. It creates a 'lecture' feel where the biblical characters are the primary actors.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Historical narrative of Easter and Job.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Theology of suffering) -> Directive (Let our answer be hers).
voorbeelden: The resurrection happened... Let our answer be hers.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The 'answer' is requested before the 'gift' is fully declared to the hearer.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (God's power) -> Commissive (God has power to grant life).
voorbeelden: We proclaim to you... the living Word... having power to grant life.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Emerges only in the final paragraphs of each section.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: In believing, receive the gift of eternal light.
voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: We just have to help each other through it (Moralistic directive).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a brilliant theological and literary exposition that 'talks about' the event of revelation but rarely 'performs' it as a present-tense encounter.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The extensive retelling of the Job narrative.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is an event of 'learning about God' rather than 'being addressed by God'.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Lacks the 'I forgive you' or 'Christ is here for you' directness.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is described as a speaker in the past (to Job), but the preacher rarely lets God speak 'now'.
tekstueel_bewijs: We proclaim to you today not our own voice but the living Word of God.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, in the closing of the Job section.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, faith is seen as the Spirit's work.
tekstueel_bewijs: Through the Word of God the Holy Spirit creates such faith.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Implicitly held, but rhetorically functions more as a lecture.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Strong in imagery, weak in address.
tekstueel_bewijs: The rising sun revealed the victory already accomplished.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many past-tense assertives. Needs more present-tense commissives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The rising sun revealed the victory already accomplished.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, the rising Sun of Righteousness shines upon you, declaring your victory over death.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from historical fact to present reality.

voorbeeldzinnen: In the name of the Risen Christ, I promise you: your dust is not the end.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'Mary did this' and 'Job did that'.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Interweave the hearer's story into the biblical story more aggressively.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are Mary in the dark; you are Thomas with the questions.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: Generally well-balanced, but the indicative needs more 'force'.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Strengthen the Declarative before the Directive.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: Theologically profound and literarily beautiful, but needs to step out from 'behind the text' to address the congregation with the authority of the Risen Lord.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about doubt; SAT focuses on the 'Divine Act' of the Word creating faith.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric seeks to persuade; SAT seeks to 'do' something to the hearer's status before God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that despite the beautiful language, the sermon remains largely descriptive (constative) rather than creative (performative).

kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: The most performative moment in the sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Prayer' sections to do the performative work that the 'Sermon' sections avoid.
